Macros | Functions
Time Utility Functions
utils

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides time and date utilities for Ambiq Micro devices. It enables real-time clock operations, time/date conversions, and calendar functions for embedded applications requiring accurate timekeeping. The utilities support various time formats and calendar calculations.

Key Features

  1. Leap Year Detection: Accurate leap year calculation and validation.
  2. Day of Week Computation: Calculate weekday for any given date.
  3. Date Validation: Comprehensive date range and format checking.
  4. Calendar Arithmetic: Month and year calculations with proper handling.
  5. RTC Integration: Real-Time Clock compatibility and time structure support.
  6. Month Offset Tables: Optimized lookup tables for calendar calculations.

Functionality

  • Calculate day of week for any valid date
  • Validate date ranges and leap year conditions
  • Perform calendar arithmetic operations
  • Handle month offset calculations
  • Support RTC time structure manipulation
  • Provide leap year detection algorithms
  • Enable date format validation
  • Support embedded time management systems

Usage

  1. Initialize time utilities for target application
  2. Validate input dates using leap year detection
  3. Calculate day of week using am_util_time_computeDayofWeek()
  4. Perform calendar arithmetic operations
  5. Integrate with RTC systems for time management

Configuration

  • Leap Year Algorithm: Zeller's congruence for day calculation
  • Month Offset Tables: Pre-calculated offsets for efficiency
  • Date Validation: Range checking for years, months, and days
  • Calendar Support: Gregorian calendar system implementation
  • RTC Compatibility: Real-Time Clock integration support

Macros

#define AM_UTIL_TIME_IS_LEAP_YEAR(year)    (year % 4 == 0 && ((year % 100 != 0) || (year % 400 != 0)))
 Calculate whether passed in year is a leap year.
 

Functions

int am_util_time_computeDayofWeek (int iYear, int iMonth, int iDay)
 Compute the day of the week given the month, day, and year.
 

Macro Definition Documentation

◆ AM_UTIL_TIME_IS_LEAP_YEAR

#define AM_UTIL_TIME_IS_LEAP_YEAR ( year)     (year % 4 == 0 && ((year % 100 != 0) || (year % 400 != 0)))

Calculate whether passed in year is a leap year.

Parameters
year- year to check for leap year

Function Documentation

◆ am_util_time_computeDayofWeek()

int am_util_time_computeDayofWeek ( int iYear,
int iMonth,
int iDay )

Compute the day of the week given the month, day, and year.

Parameters
iYear- The year of the desired date (e.g. 2016).
iMonth- The month of the desired date (1-12).
iDay- The day of the month of the desired date (1-31).

This function is general in nature, but is designed to be used with the RTC.

Returns
An index value indicating the day of the week. 0-6 indicate Sun, Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, respectively. 7 indicates that the given date is invalid (e.g. 2/29/2015).
